This is the second generation of the Lenovo Thinkpad X13 Yoga, an Intel based 2-in-1 laptop with a 13.3 inch touch screen, that was introduced in February 2021. The laptop screen can be folded over transforming the device in a tablet like device, and it comes with a stylus as an extra form of input. It uses the Intel Iris Xe graphics card and the 11th generation of Intel processors.

sections.title: Accessibility
sections.content: The UEFI setup utility presents modern graphic and mouse support. You can switch back to the classic text-mode user interface from withing the setup utility in order to increase compatibility with screen readers. A sighted person should support with changing this setting. The modern graphical mode is the factory default.

sections.title: Firmware
sections.content: In August of 2018 Lenovo has joined the Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS) project, which enables firmware updates from within the OS. BIOS updates (and possibly other firmware such as the Thunderbolt controller) can be queried for and installed through fwupd.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Disable Secure Boot in the BIOS to boot from a USB stick.

sections.title: Touchpad
sections.content:
The touchpad which identifies as ELAN0674:00 04F3:3193 Touchpad is not very responsive. Sometimes the cursor jumps randomly when trying to perform a tap. This can be verified with https://no-cursor.com/, taking 60 seconds to complete the test.

Removing the psmouse module seems to improve the touchpad. After this, the trackpoint and the physical touchpad buttons stop working but the touchpad becomes more usable; it now only takes 30 seconds to complete the above test.

The fix for IdeaPad 3 14IIL05 may also work.

This no longer appears to be the case; the touchpad now works out of the box.

sections.title: Audio
sections.content: This laptop requires Sound Open Firmware in order for the soundcard to work.
